page.title: 05FARMING, CHICKEN FARM
page.content: The farm which we visited lies on Dalton Back Lane. THe chickens are brought from a hatchery near Thirsk and about 600,000 birds pass through the farm each year. They are strictly rationed -170 tons of grain and 13,000 gallons of water for 13,500 pullets, in 30 days. Each crop of chickens stays until they are 42 to 72 days old and then they are moved to town factories to be killed. After each crop the farm is cleaned and disinfected and clean chopped straw is put down. The large concern which owns this farm has other farms in the area. The managers live on the site but are not allowed to keep pigs or pigeons in case disease spreads to the chickens.The present managers have been at the farm for 17 years and work with a floating staff.
